channel.title: First Android Game - On PlayStore - Give Opinions and Feedback
channel.description:
Well, was messing around with the Unity Engine. Made my first game. Would appreciate anyone to test it/rate it.
Leave your honest opinions and suggestions. I'd love to make it something that people actually enjoy.
The theme for the game was, "Annoyingly hard" - the same pretences as the infamous "Flappy Bird".
Here's the Link to the game on the Android App Store: https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.MichboardINC.GreenLight
I will be posting my Progress / Adding of content
=Features= -Google Play integration --Sign in with your google account --Achievements for score --Highscore list for your score
=Updates= Version 1.1 -Changed Main Menu to fit screen Properly -Added Google Play Integration --Achievements,Highscore Leadboards -Fixed Game Crash error when turning screen into portrait mode -Fixed spacing and boxes for Text to display properly. -Added Buttons on main menu to show achievements and leaderboards -Added Jumping Sound -Added 8-Bit Type Music
Version 1.15 -Added animated background for main menu, and game screen -Changed Fonts to a more Game style -Changed player sprite to single unit -Added a make-shift jump animation(nothing fancy, I suck at art....) -Made new PlayerPreferences(Death Count Total, Successful Jump Total) -Added new Death Achievements -Re-allocated achievement points to allow for future achievement realeases. -Added "Game Over" screen, allowing user to see played score, and their current Highscore.
Version 1.16(Currently being pushed on Google Play Store - Takes 1-4 hours for Formal Publication) -Fixed Game Over Screen Size(My silly self forgot to portion the UI based on Screen Size.... DERP!!) Version 1.161 -Fixed Game Over Text being off screen(Novice issues, bare with me... Lol)
==Working On== -Options Menu(Toggle Sounds, Music)
==Hopes for Future Updates== -Character Selection(Male, Female, Different Figures(Both natural and funny)) ---Hold Back on Charcter Selection(Must create Jump Animations for each Character that is choosable. Again, I'm terrible with ART) -Better music on game -Better looking Game Icon -Better looking App Store images.(Looks very basic, but the game is quite basic) -Better looking GUI -Better All-Around Sprites(I would like some type of unity. Charcters design needs to match backgrounds design) -More Achievements -More Leaderboards(Possibly death leaderboard?) -More Secure(Game is currently saving variables in a playerPrefs file on the device. Easily editable;therefor, causing leaderboards to be potentially "Not-Fair"

item.title: First Android Game - On PlayStore - Give Opinions and Feedback
item.dc:creator: @Mezzyscape562 Mezzyscape562
item.description:
@Mezzyscape562 wrote:

Niglett:

Please post pics

Are you stupid…?
He clearly posted the link which as you may have not guessed, contains pictures, and information about the game.

play.google.com

Red Light Green Light

NeverJudge

In this "Annoying" game, you will have to test your quick reaction skills. Can you get a highscore? Can you beat your friends? Play and find out! Get Achievements, and make your way to the top of the leaderboards!In diesem "Annoying" Spiel, müssen Sie Ihre schnelle Reaktion Fähigkeiten zu testen. Können Sie einen Highscore zu bekommen? Können Sie schlagen Ihre Freunde? Spielen Sie und finden Sie heraus! Holen Erfolge, und machen Sie Ihren Weg an die Spitze der Ranglisten...

Free

Read full topic

item.title: First Android Game - On PlayStore - Give Opinions and Feedback
item.dc:creator: @tyb97 tyb97
item.description:
@tyb97 wrote:

[quote=“RandQm, post:8, topic:552674”]I made a simple stupid game (it’s here in this section posted btw)
Weeks of nothing and then suddenly it started getting installs.
At 1000 installs right now and 50 on the paid version.
It just came out of nowhere, just make stuff because you like doing it and it’ll all turn out fine.[/quote]
Mine never had this occur, but you just never know what’s gonna work out. The mobile market it much more suited to just making games for the hell of it and seeing if anyone plays it. Never do anything crazy like quit your job or anything because that market doesn’t work like that.

Read full topic
item.source: First Android Game - On PlayStore - Give Opinions and Feedback

item.title: First Android Game - On PlayStore - Give Opinions and Feedback
item.dc:creator: @RandQm RandQm
item.description:
@RandQm wrote:

I made a simple stupid game (it’s here in this section posted btw)
Weeks of nothing and then suddenly it started getting installs.
At 1000 installs right now and 50 on the paid version.
It just came out of nowhere, just make stuff because you like doing it and it’ll all turn out fine.

item.title: First Android Game - On PlayStore - Give Opinions and Feedback
item.dc:creator: @wetodded wetodded
item.description:
@wetodded wrote:

Oh absolutely. I have realistic wants. I just wanted a little feedback to allow myself to grow into a better developer. I just do it in my spare time. I appreciate the words of wisdom

Read full topic
item.source: First Android Game - On PlayStore - Give Opinions and Feedback

item.title: First Android Game - On PlayStore - Give Opinions and Feedback
item.dc:creator: @tyb97 tyb97
item.description:
@tyb97 wrote:

wetodded:

Actually myself, and my Wife that had rated it. Lol

The mobile platform isn’t what everyone who’s never been part of it says it’s like. Don’t expect any exposure, or any hits or anything like that. Just make simple little games for the hell of it. I remember my first game, we got like 100 downloads, made like $0.03 on ads (which I never saw). Good job, use this as a step to keep on going.

Read full topic

Kiryn:

Are those your parents rating it? :palm:

There’s a problem with that? Friends and family are usually the only ones you can get to play your game to start.

item.title: First Android Game - On PlayStore - Give Opinions and Feedback
item.dc:creator: @wetodded wetodded
item.description:
@wetodded wrote:

Well, was messing around with the Unity Engine. Made my first game.
Would appreciate anyone to test it/rate it.

Leave your honest opinions and suggestions. I’d love to make it something that people actually enjoy.

The theme for the game was, “Annoyingly hard” - the same pretences as the infamous “Flappy Bird”.

Here’s the Link to the game on the Android App Store: https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.MichboardINC.GreenLight

I will be posting my Progress / Adding of content

=Features=
-Google Play integration
–Sign in with your google account
–Achievements for score
–Highscore list for your score

=Updates=
Version 1.1
-Changed Main Menu to fit screen Properly
-Added Google Play Integration
–Achievements,Highscore Leadboards
-Fixed Game Crash error when turning screen into portrait mode
-Fixed spacing and boxes for Text to display properly.
-Added Buttons on main menu to show achievements and leaderboards
-Added Jumping Sound
-Added 8-Bit Type Music

Version 1.15
-Added animated background for main menu, and game screen
-Changed Fonts to a more Game style
-Changed player sprite to single unit
-Added a make-shift jump animation(nothing fancy, I suck at art…)
-Made new PlayerPreferences(Death Count Total, Successful Jump Total)
-Added new Death Achievements
-Re-allocated achievement points to allow for future achievement realeases.
-Added “Game Over” screen, allowing user to see played score, and their current Highscore.

Version 1.16(Currently being pushed on Google Play Store - Takes 1-4 hours for Formal Publication)
-Fixed Game Over Screen Size(My silly self forgot to portion the UI based on Screen Size… DERP!!)
Version 1.161
-Fixed Game Over Text being off screen(Novice issues, bare with me… Lol)

==Working On==
-Options Menu(Toggle Sounds, Music)

==Hopes for Future Updates==
-Character Selection(Male, Female, Different Figures(Both natural and funny))
—Hold Back on Charcter Selection(Must create Jump Animations for each Character that is choosable. Again, I’m terrible with ART)
-Better music on game
-Better looking Game Icon
-Better looking App Store images.(Looks very basic, but the game is quite basic)
-Better looking GUI
-Better All-Around Sprites(I would like some type of unity. Charcters design needs to match backgrounds design)
-More Achievements
-More Leaderboards(Possibly death leaderboard?)
-More Secure(Game is currently saving variables in a playerPrefs file on the device. Easily editable;therefor, causing leaderboards to be potentially “Not-Fair”

Read full topic
